intro: Iresine diffusa, commonly known as red leaf iron plant, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage, which often features vibrant red, purple, or pink hues on the undersides of its leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Iresine diffusa thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its unique leaf coloration.
